intro: Chondrilla stipitata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial herb with erect, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Chondrilla stipitata is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
